header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 30, Volume III-6, February 1978

central_thesis: The collected articles elucidate the foundational philosophical tenets, psychological models, and practical approaches for individual self-creation (Xeper) and organizational principles within the Temple of Set, emphasizing the distinct nature and path of the Setian through self-integration and conscious will.

structure_content.summary: This article introduces the concept of a Setian Mandala as a double cone representing the journey of self-evolution. The lower cone, depicted by Michelangelo's 'Man' in a pentagram, symbolizes mundane human life, with stages aligning with the Fibonacci Series (birth to ages 21-34). The upper cone represents the Setian aspect of life and the Path toward Xeper (infinity), where the Fibonacci Series becomes irrelevant. The Pentagram itself is described as a mandala representing the self's progress on the path to Xeper, moving from empty to full. The concept 'Form is emptiness; emptiness is form' from a Buddhist text is adapted to the Setian understanding of existence in both cones.

structure_content.chapter_title: [2] An Organization and Philosophy to Build Upon
structure_content.summary: This article outlines guiding principles for the Temple of Set, stressing the importance of individual will, independent thought, continuous advancement, and the rejection of dogma. It emphasizes that Setian goals are achieved through study and hard work, not quick, dramatic occurrences. The Temple is envisioned as a vehicle for philosophical development, attracting 'superior people' and responsive to members' needs, evolving beyond a single generation to assist future Elect. It warns against stagnation and the pitfalls of other organizations.

This article presents a psychological model of the Setian mind, featuring the Core Self (CS) as the ageless intelligence and central hub, the Function Personality (FP) as the mundane, public self (often dominant and limiting), various anonymous Aspects (A) representing other facets of self, and the Magical Entity (ME) as the channel between the Core Self and Aspects. The Magical Entity is crucial for bypassing the Function Personality's barriers, integrating the Aspects, and enabling the Core Self's will to direct the being towards a 'new self' in Setian evolution. It criticizes the Function Personality's tendency to dominate and obscure other aspects of the self.

This article delves into Xeper, the Word of the Æon, defining it as 'exist/be/become'. It emphasizes Xeper as a continuous process of self-creation and evolution, not a static state. The Setian path involves asserting one's will to become what one is not yet, transcending physical limitations and even death through the force of will. It posits that the Setian's path is one of unending growth and conquest of new avenues, defining Setamorphosis as this strong, beautiful, and unending process of evolution.

This article asserts that the Temple of Set embodies 'the true religion' and its members are inherently 'Elect' due to their superior perceptive faculty and ability to apply their understanding. It argues that Setians have a moral right to prioritize their own kind and advancement, even if it means using or destroying non-Elect individuals if they impede Setian goals. It outlines a pragmatic approach to interacting with non-Elect, ranging from cooperation to destruction, based on their utility or threat to the Setian's path. The core principle is that Setians are 'alien to mankind' and must act with ruthless self-interest and intellectual balance.

key_concepts.definition: A double-cone visualization representing the Setian's path to Xeper, with the bottom cone symbolizing mundane life (Fibonacci Series) and the upper cone symbolizing Setian existence and infinite evolution, centered around the Pentagram.
The core Setian principle meaning 'exist/be/become', signifying continuous, conscious self-creation, evolution, and the assertion of individual will beyond current limitations.
The ageless intelligence within each being, representing the ultimate self and the center of the mind, which is the source of will and energy.
The mundane, public self; a dominant Aspect that serves to function in conscious reality but often acts as a 'petty tyrant', censoring other Aspects and limiting the self's potential for evolution.

A construct or spontaneously arising Aspect that serves as a channel from the Core Self to the other Aspects and beyond, bypassing the Function Personality's barriers to facilitate integration and direction of the will towards Xeper.
Various dimensions and facets of the self, including the Function Personality, which surround and are fed by the Core Self. They represent different parts of one's being that need to be integrated.
Setians, distinguished by their superior perceptive faculty, intellectual balance, and ability to pursue Xeper. They are considered separate and superior to the 'non-Elect' (ordinary humans).
The unending and dynamic process of Setian evolution through Xeper, signifying continuous transformation and growth.
A symbolic representation of the Setian's life and individual path to Xeper, used for visualization and channeling will.

practical_system.description: The Setian practical system for self-evolution (Xeper) centers on the conscious development and integration of the 'Integrated Self'. This involves: 1. Understanding the internal structure of the mind (Core Self, Function Personality, Aspects). 2. Developing a 'Magical Entity' as a conduit for the Core Self's will to bypass the limiting Function Personality. 3. Using self-observation, meditation, and ritual (e.g., 'Yoga From Yuggoth') to unify diverse 'Aspects' and direct one's entire being towards chosen goals. 4. Visualizing the 'Setian Mandala' and Pentagram as tools for conceptualizing and advancing one's unique path. The goal is to achieve 'Setamorphosis', a continuous state of becoming, where the Setian asserts their will to transcend limitations, even death, and operates as an 'Elect' being, alien to mankind.
rituals: Sutra Telling the Heart of the Great Transcending Wisdom

relevant_quotes.text: The bottom cone, as I visualize it, is clear. There is nothing there to grasp at for life and survival. Again 'Form is emptiness; emptiness is form.'
Once we have entered the upper cone as Setians, the Fibonacci Series becomes irrelevant because time in this cone is relative.
A Setian should commit himself to the full development of his will and exercise independent thought.
Essentially when the function personality dominates to the exclusion of everything else, the being can only see down a narrow tunnel.
The Magical Entity then becomes a channel of the Core Self as we send our energies through it and out by our will through the pentagram.
To give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
What then is Xeper? The Word of the Æon on which we ponder and then act.
If the Elect are the Elect, then they have that right. The Setian must take upon himself the responsibility of tracing the consequences of his convictions to their logical conclusions.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles provides a foundational and intricate framework for understanding Setian philosophy and operative magic, particularly concerning individual self-evolution (Xeper). It distinguishes Setianism from other esoteric paths through its emphasis on independent will, intellectual rigor, and a unique psychological model for self-integration. The practical implications, such as the development of the Magical Entity and the ethical considerations of Setian elitism, offer a coherent system for personal transformation and interaction with the mundane world. It is highly relevant for those studying the specific doctrines of the Temple of Set and modern esoteric self-actualization systems.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience is initiates of the Temple of Set, particularly those on the path of Xeper, seeking a deeper understanding of Setian philosophy, the psychological structure of the self according to Setian tenets, and practical methods for individual evolution. It is also valuable for academic researchers and practitioners of Western Esotericism interested in the specific theories and practices of a distinct Left Hand Path organization.
